data.title: Northeastern University Library Popular Magazine & Newspaper Subscriptions
data.meta_description: Does your department subscribe to the Chronicle of Higher Education or other popular titles via individual...
data.text:
Does your department subscribe to the Chronicle of Higher Education or other popular titles via individual subscriptions?

The library offers access to several user-friendly online subscriptions that can replace subscriptions currently purchased by various departments across campus!

Take a look at the titles below to see if this access would allow you to discontinue individual subscriptions – ultimately presenting cost savings to your department. (Don’t forget to cancel any paid subscriptions!)

For most of the titles below, simply click on the image then sign in with your Northeastern username and password.

The Wall Street Journal and STAT Plus both require additional registration with a Northeastern email address. Details are included under those titles.

For any questions or concerns, please use the Library Help form or contact Ryan McNally, [email protected].

Account creation with a Northeastern email address is required for this resource.

As an alternative to the link above, users can create a personal account using your Northeastern email address and then log in directly on the site.

Access requires registration with a Northeastern email address.

Access requires registration with a Northeastern email address. Once registered, users can log in directly at https://www.nytimes.com.

Users need to use this link (which can also be found on the Databases page), then log in with their Northeastern credentials before creating a STAT Plus account with their Northeastern email address.

Users must fill out the linked form to register for a free personal account using their Northeastern email address. Once registered, use the 'Sign In' button on this page or the Wall Street Journal home page to access the site.
